item.term: Early first millennium to the fourth century BC (predominance of Saba)
Fourth to first centuries BC (predominance of Qataban and Hadramawt, and their alliance with Main)
First century BC to early second century AD (alliances between the tribes of the high plateau and the ASA kingdoms)
Late second to late third centuries AD (wars among the Himyar, Saba and Hadramawt)
Fourth to sixth centuries AD (unification of Yemen under Himyarite rule)

Barqum Nimrān of the lineage of Suʾrān and Muḥaylum, qayls
of the tribe of Bakīlum, the quarter of Dhū-Raydat, has dedicated
to their patron-deity Sāmiʿ in Ḥaramatān this inscrip-
tion out of gratitude because he fulfilled for him all the oracles
which he had sought from him as a promise of protection in order to give them aid
against the storm during the springtime rainy season, which came in the month of Bi-
ʿathtar bin Maʿdīkarib bin Ḥazfirum, and they re-
stored their faith to Sāmiʿ their faith because he had fulfilled for them his ora-
cle and they brought forth a good crop and of the storm
they saw no more. And may Sāmiʿ continue to fulfill for hiss er-
vants of the lineage of Suʾrān all the oracles which they might seek
from him. And he grant them prosperity and
well-being and good crops in their lands
and their fields.
